item.title: How To Solve the Time Oddity Puzzle in the Desert Region in Cronos: The New Dawn
item.description:
Puzzles in a survival horror setting are a must and are often crucial for progression. Despite Cronos: The New Dawn not having a large amount of them, the ones that are present can be somewhat confusing to most players, challenging them to figure out solutions while navigating the game's unsettling environments and story.

One of the puzzles in the Desert Region of the game requires lifting some structures which are obstructed by the Time Oddity . Here's everything you need to know about solving this puzzle in Cronos: The New Dawn .

How To Solve the Time Oddity Puzzle in the Desert Region in Cronos: The New Dawn

After going toward the Steelworks in Sector A-11 , your objective will change and you will need to make your way to the Dive Point . This region is experiencing a constant sandstorm, which will make the outside area hard to navigate through. You can follow the objective marker by pressing the R3 button and soon you will come across a broken down building connected to the Steelworks. Here you can find a Time Oddity puzzle , and after going into the building, you need to interact with the orb on the right.

There are a few wooden crates on your left, which have Energy that you can use for upgrades.

After interacting with the orb, you will realize that some part of the debris has lifted, but this still has not opened up a path. What most players will miss and will frantically search everywhere outside the building is that there is another Time Oddity orb inside the building, but it is located toward your back and on the ceiling. This can be very easy to miss. Once you interact with both orbs, follow these steps:

  • Head to the right of the building.
  • After that, interact with the orb through the window to move the pallet down .
  • Interact with the orb again to raise it up, allowing you to head inside the next building and progress through the story.

item.title: Helldivers 2 Players Are Split on the New Bugs
item.description:
Helldivers players are split on the new bugs added after the latest update. In their travels across the galaxy, Helldivers 2 players encounter enemies from different factions who try to prevent them from ensuring the safety of Super Earth and spreading Managed Democracy.

With the release of the newest Helldivers 2 update, Into the Unjust, the dangers have increased with the introduction of Hive Worlds. These desert planets feature a dangerous, randomly generated cave system, and the first Hive World, Oshaune, is now ready to be explored. Accompanying the introduction of the new planets, players have a new set of missions to complete, including destroying Hive Lungs in caves and escorting a mobile oil rig. Into the Unjust has also brought new enemies for Helldivers 2 players to face, but they are creating polarized reactions within the community.

Helldivers 2 Players Can't Agree on the New Bugs

The Helldivers 2 community is divided over the new bugs, with some enjoying the additions and others not so pleased with them. Redditor lebaminoba asked players to learn how to deal with the new Helldivers 2 enemies first, rather than asking for nerfs. Meanwhile, user __Elzy expressed their frustration with players who are against nerfs, posting a clip in which they are killed by one of these creatures in just one blow. Using humor, Redditor Stoneybro13 posted a meme depicting the community's current situation on the subject.

With the release of Into the Unjust, Helldivers 2 added four Terminids found in the new Hive Worlds. Rupture Spewers live up to their name by attacking with corrosive acid spew and burrowing into the ground to regenerate. Rupture Warriors are a mutation of the Warrior already known to players, but without the UV-chitin. Due to this, they are weak against sunlight and prefer to stay underground. Chargers are a variant altered by the Gloom, the new threat in Helldivers 2 , and their biggest weapon is high speed. Dragonroach is a flying creature similar to the Bile Titan that also launches acid attacks against players.

Arrowhead has not yet addressed the controversy over the balance of the new Terminids, which is not the only challenge players are facing. With the arrival of Into the Unjust, Helldivers 2 is having performance issues and crashes, preventing the community from fully immersing themselves in the new content. Thus, gamers wait for upcoming patches with improvements and to find out whether these bugs will be balanced or not.

Join forces with up to three friends and wreak havoc on an alien scourge threatening the safety of your home planet, Super Earth, in this multiplayer co-op shooter for PS5 and PC from Arrowhead Game Studios.
Step into the boots of the Helldivers, an elite class of soldiers whose mission is to spread peace, liberty and Managed Democracy using the biggest, baddest and most explosive tools in the galaxy.
Helldivers don't go planet side without proper backup, but it’s up to you to decide how and when to call it in. Not only do you have a host of superpowered primary weapons and customizable loadouts, you also have the ability to call on stratagems during play.
Helldivers 2 features Arrowhead's best cooperative gameplay yet. Collaboration will be vital: Teams will synergize on loadouts, strategize their approach for each mission and complete objectives together.1

item.title: Genshin Impact Leak Reveals New 5-Star Character for Version 6.1
item.description:
A recent leak from a reliable source in the Genshin Impact community has revealed that Version 6.1 will mark the debut of Nefer, a 5-Star Dendro Catalyst whose kit will completely overhaul Dendro Cores. While the Nod-Krai era is yet to begin in earnest, Genshin Impact is slowly setting the stage for Lunar Reactions – the main combat mechanic of the new region. Lunar-Charged was introduced with Ineffa in Version 5.8, and now Version 6.0 is set to introduce Lunar-Bloom with the debut of Lauma.

As a 5-Star Dendro Catalyst, Lauma can best be described as a support character in Genshin Impact who specializes in two branches: either by buffing Lunar-Bloom for Nod-Krai teams or by buffing Bloom for Dendro teams. This makes her an incredibly valuable support, as she synergizes with hypercarries such as Nilou, Neuvillette, and the upcoming Nefer.

Genshin Impact Could Be Releasing Nefer in Version 6.1

According to Uncle Kokomi, a source who has accrued respectable credibility in 2025, Nefer will be a 5-Star Dendro Catalyst with a focus on the Lunar-Bloom reaction. Given that they share the element and weapon type, what sets Nefer apart from Lauma in Genshin Impact is that she will be a dedicated Lunar-Bloom hypercarry. As such, her synergy with Lauma is obvious – either Lauma will partner up with Nefer to buff her Lunar-Bloom damage, or remain with older hypercarries as the sole Nod-Krai character.

However, there is one controversial aspect of Nefer's presumed ability kit that players should keep in mind. Nefer will prevent the creation of Dendro Cores, which will effectively close her off from any existing Bloom, Burgeon, and Hyperbloom teams in Genshin Impact . Much like Lauma, Nefer will collect Verdant Dews by triggering Bloom, spending it with her Elemental Skill. This appears to be the real mechanic that separates Lunar-Bloom from the original Bloom, turning it from an Area-of-Effect reaction to a Single Target reaction.

If one were to assume the Nod-Krai roadmap for Genshin Impact characters is correct, then Nefer will be the sole debut of Version 6.1. Players will be able to stock up on a considerable number of Primogems during Version 6.0, and assuming they skip the Sumeru Chronicled Banner, they should have enough Intertwined Wishes to guarantee Nefer. Barring no surprises, Nefer and Lauma will likely be the sole Dendro characters in Nod-Krai. If this playstyle appeals to fans, they should try to obtain both 5-Stars ahead of Columbina, who is speculated to be a Hydro support for Nod-Krai teams.

item.title: Arcane's Jinx and Vi Recreated in The Sims 4
item.description:
A Sims 4 player has done an impressive job recreating Arcane 's Vi and Jinx in the game. While plenty of Sims 4 fans enjoy making brand-new characters, others look to the character creator to remake their favorites from other media.

The Sims 4 has been out for over a decade now, and in that time, it has amassed numerous expansions, kits, and stuff packs. These items, combined with the myriads of mods created for The Sims 4 , allow players to make nearly anything they set their minds to. League of Legends , the game which Arcane was based off of, is even older, yet both games remain popular all these years later.

Sims 4 and League of Legends Fan Recreates Jinx and Vi from Arcane

Over on Reddit, a user by the name of Czushimi shared a recreation they made of Jinx and Vi from Arcane in the game. The OP only shared two screenshots, with one of each character, but they're enough to see the immense attention to detail that was paid to the recreations. Jinx's appearance has been recreated well, complete with her iconic hairstyle, blue tattoos, and crop top. The similarity to the original is increased by the use of cel shading-like textures.

The same level of attention was given to Jinx's sister, Vi. She, too, strongly resembles her Arcane depiction, with the asymmetrical hairstyle, sharp features, VI tattoo under her eye, and outfit all present. She also appears to have the Atlas Gauntlets, though it's hard to see them as the image is cut off at the waist. Even the cut through her eyebrow is present, albeit in a slightly different position.

Unfortunately, as of the time of publication, Czushimi hasn't explained how they made these remarkable recreations of the Arcane cast. Judging from their appearance and prior posts made by the OP, it's likely that numerous mods were used in the creation of the League of Legends characters.

Arcane was critically acclaimed and well-regarded by fans of League of Legends , but the series has now come to an end with the release of season 2. While Arcane won't be returning, League of Legends fans can look forward to more spin-offs based off of the game. With a large cast of characters, there should be plenty of ground to cover and fan-favorites to revisit, but fans will have to sit tight, as not much has been revealed about the future projects.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3's Honour Mode is Apparently Easier Than Being a Bard
item.description:
When it first came out of Early Access on August 3, 2023, Baldur’s Gate 3 had 53 achievements. Some of them are extremely easy to get; for example, Descent from Avernus is earned simply by completing the prologue, while Bedrolls and Breakfast is obtained by taking four Long Rests. Others, like Jack-of-all-Trades and Leave No One Behind, are tricky, and require diligence and commitment throughout an entire Baldur’s Gate 3 playthrough.

Then, on November 30, 2023, Baldur’s Gate 3 added its 54th achievement: Foehammer, earned by completing the game on Honour Mode. This new difficulty setting not only added extra challenges to Baldur's Gate 3 , but removed the ability to reload saves. Considering the high stakes of this permadeath mode, one would assume Foehammer was the rarest achievement in the game – and yet, that accolade belongs to another accomplishment that seems much easier to get on the surface.

Busker – The Rarest Achievement in Baldur’s Gate 3

Being a Street Performer in Baldur’s Gate 3 is Apparently Harder Than Honour Mode

The Busker achievement in Baldur’s Gate 3 is earned by making 100 gold by performing music in one playthrough. On its surface, this achievement does not seem particularly hard to get; after all, it just requires one to make some money performing. However, it is slightly more complicated than it seems – so much so that only 2.4% of all players on Steam have earned the achievement so far, even over two years after release.

For comparison, the Foehammer achievement has been obtained by 2.7% of all Steam users – 0.3% more people than Busker. This means a greater number of players have gone through an entire playthrough on Honour Mode, permadeath and all, than have made a career as a Bard in Baldur’s Gate 3 .

Top 10 Rarest Achievements on Baldur's Gate 3 (According to Steam September 2025)

Achievement

Description

% Earned by All Players

Busker

Earn 100 gold from Performing in one playthrough.

2.4%

Foehammer

Complete the game in Honour mode.

2.7%

Punch Drunk

Defeat 20 opponents while drunk.

2.8%

Jack-of-all-Trades

Multiclass into every class in one playthrough without respeccing

3%

SPOILER

The evil ending of the Dark Urge storyline.

3.2%

She Cannot Be Caged!

Rescue Sazza three times in one playthrough.

3.3%

Fancy Footwork

Defeat Gortash in Wyrm's Rock without activating any traps.

5.0%

Hot Date

Go on a date with Karlach.

5.8%

Leave No One Behind

Save every tiefling refugee in one playthrough.

5.8%

Critical Hit

Complete the game in Tactician mode.

5.8%

What makes this particularly hilarious is that this achievement doesn’t even require a character to be a Bard in order to obtain it. Characters of any class can obtain musical proficiency to take the Perform action, even without an instrument equipped. That said, the achievement is time-consuming and finicky enough that it has still somehow remained the hardest achievement to earn in the game.

How to Earn the Busker Achievement in BG3

The first step towards earning the rarest achievement in Baldur’s Gate 3 is to get proficiency in Musical Instruments. There are three ways to make this happen:

  • Take at least one level in Bard
  • Take the Performer Feat
  • Successfully perform with Alfira in the Emerald Grove in Act 1

Once obtained, the character gains a new action called Perform. Using this causes a handful of nearby named NPCs to gather around, after which the character makes a Charisma (Performance) check. On a success, the audience members will throw down gold pieces that can be collected. While fans can attempt to do this earlier in the game, waiting until Act 3 is much easier, as the city of Baldur’s Gate is full of NPCs to donate to a character’s burgeoning career as a musician.

A character can use the Perform action without having an instrument equipped by Whistling. There is no mechanical difference between instruments, though it will change the sound of the song being performed.

There are a few other tricks players can use to make this process even easier. Using Withers, one can either recruit a Bard Hireling in Baldur's Gate 3 with maxed out Charisma and expertise in Performance, or temporarily respec themselves to do the same.

Moving about the city to perform, especially in dense areas like Elfsong Tavern and Basilik’s Gate, will ensure one can easily collect their required coins. This achievement’s progress doesn’t always update correctly, so fans shouldn’t get discouraged if the meter doesn’t change. Keep performing long enough, and the rarest achievement in Baldur’s Gate 3 will be unlocked.
